io.atomix.catalyst.transport

Interface Server

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalServer, NettyServer

    public interface Server
    Transport server.

    This is a low-level abstraction through which Catalyst servers receive connections from clients. Users should never use this API directly.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletableFuture<Void> close()
      Closes the server.
      CompletableFuture<Void> listen(Address address, Consumer<Connection> listener)
      Listens for connections on the server.

    • Method Detail

      • listen

        CompletableFuture<Void> listen(Address address,
                               Consumer<Connection> listener)
        Listens for connections on the server.

        Once the server has started listening on the provided address, Consumer.accept(Object) will be called for the provided Consumer each time a new connection to the server is established.

        Once the server has bound to the provided address the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        Parameters:
        address - The address on which to listen for connections.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be called once the server has started listening for connections.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if address or listener are null

      • close

        CompletableFuture<Void> close()
        Closes the server.

        When the server is closed, any close listeners registered on the server's Connections will be invoked prior to shutdown.

        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the server is closed.
